request_pathways.name: Authorization for Disclosure of Health Information (English)
Autorización Para la Revelación de Información Médica (Spanish)
Mail submission to HIM (P.O. Box 689, Santa Barbara, CA 93102)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Cottage Health uses a single generic HIPAA authorization form for all disclosures, with a 'Patient (self)' checkbox in Section C to accommodate self-access requests.

red_flags: Opening warning that 'Failure to provide all information requested may invalidate this authorization' could be used to reject incomplete but actionable patient requests
bright_spots: Complete Spanish-language translation maintained as a separate form (NS1406)
MyChart patient portal offered as a delivery method for requested records
Swellbox online request wizard provides a fully digital alternative to the PDF form
Electronic signatures explicitly accepted in all-caps statement
Multiple submission channels (email, fax, mail) with no in-person requirement

findability.rationale: Level 4: Medical records page is at a clear, logical navigation path (Home > Patients & Visitors > Accessing Your Medical Records) and forms are discoverable via standard web searches; minor friction from Akamai CDN blocking and coexistence of old/new form versions.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: The PDF itself has zero fillable fields (a gap), but the org offers a Swellbox online portal as a fully digital alternative, plus email and fax submission — providing a mostly digital workflow with one gap in the primary PDF form.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized into 9 lettered sections with clear headings and logical flow; language is mostly plain and accessible; 2 pages is appropriate length; minor issues with the stern 'invalidation' warning and some legalese in the restrictions section.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: The form is a generic HIPAA authorization designed for all disclosures, not specifically for patient self-access; a patient can use it via the 'Patient (self)' checkbox but must navigate irrelevant sections (recipient relationship, redisclosure restrictions) designed for third-party release.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, electronic signatures accepted, multiple submission channels, 15-day turnaround faster than HIPAA's 30-day requirement; minor ambiguities in fee disclosure ('there may be a fee' with no amounts) and the 'invalidation' warning, but nothing that would materially impede a patient.

overall.summary: Cottage Health provides a competent patient access experience with multiple pathways (PDF, Swellbox portal, email/fax), a Spanish translation, and MyChart delivery, but relies on a generic third-party authorization form rather than a dedicated patient access pathway, and the primary PDF lacks fillable fields.
